verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
I stand amazed in the presence
of Jesus the Nazarene,
and wonder how
he could love me,
a sinner, condemned, unclean.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
Oh, how marvelous!
Oh, how wonderful!
And my song shall ever be:
Oh, how marvelous!
Oh, how wonderful!
Is my Savior’s love for me!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
For me it was in the garden
he prayed:
“Not my will, but Thine.”
He had no tears
for his own griefs,
but sweat drops of blood
for mine.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
In pity angels beheld him,
and came from
the world of light
to comfort him in the sorrows
he bore for my soul that night.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
He took my sins
and my sorrows,
he made them his very own;
he bore the burden
to Calv’ry,
and suffered and died alone.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
When with the
ransomed in glory
his face I at last shall see,
’Twill be my joy
through the ages
to sing of his love for me.
